name: Baked eggs with spinach & tomato
description: "Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the spinach into a colander
category: then pour over a kettle of boiling water to wilt the leaves. Squeeze out excess water and divide between 4 small ovenproof dishes.\nMix the tomatoes with the chilli flakes and some seasoning
photo: then add to the dishes with the spinach. Make a small well in the centre of each and crack in an egg. Bake for 12-15 mins or more depending on how you like your eggs. Serve with crusty bread

name: Mushroom & basil omelette
description: "Heat the grill to its highest setting and place the tomatoes on a square of foil underneath
category: turning occasionally to prevent burning. When the tomatoes are slightly scorched
column8: squashing them slightly to release the juices.\nBreak the eggs into a bowl and mix with a fork. Add a small splash of water and mix. Add the chives and some black pepper
column9: and beat some more. Set aside while you prepare the mushrooms.\nIn a non-stick frying pan
column10: heat the butter over a medium heat until foaming. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5-8 mins until tender
column11: stirring every few mins. Remove and set aside.\nBriskly stir the egg mixture
column12: then add to the hot pan (tilting it so that the mixture covers the entire base) and leave for 10 secs or so until it begins to set. With a fork
column13: gently stir the egg here and there so that any unset mixture gets cooked.\nWhile the egg mixture is still slightly loose
column14: spoon the mushroom mix onto one side of the omelette
column15: and top with the cream cheese and basil leaves. Flip the other side of the omelette over to cover
column16: if you like. Leave to cook for 1 min more
column17: then cut in half and slide each half onto a plate. Serve immediately with the tomatoes on the side."

name: Fruitburst muffins
description: "Preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6/ fan 180C and very lightly butter a 12-hole muffin tin. Sift the flour and baking powder into a bowl. In another bowl
photo: then stir in the melted butter
column8: milk and honey. Add to the flour with the remaining ingredients. Combine quickly without overworking (it’s fine if there are some lumps left – you want it gloopy rather than fluid). Spoon the mixture into the muffin tin. Bake for 20-25 minutes until well risen and pale golden on top.\nLeave in the tin for a few minutes before turning out. When cool
column9: they’ll keep in an airtight tin for two days. (Can be frozen for up to 1 month.)"
